oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Private Robert Archer Cheatham, Company C, 1st (Field's) Tennessee Infantry

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Portrait photographs; Soldiers; Uniforms; Military uniforms
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee - History - Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Half length portrait of Confederate Private Robert Archer Cheatham, First Tennessee Infantry. He wears a Confederate uniform and kepi.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Calvert Brothers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Robert Archer Cheatham was the son of Col. Edward Saunders Cheatham, at one time Speaker of the Senate of Tennessee, and Jane Ellen Foster. Jane Ellen Foster Cheatham's father, Ephraim Hubbard Foster, was a senator from Tennessee. The photograph is reproduced from Calvert plate #312. The original was taken between 1861 and 1865. It was reprinted by Calvert Brothers in the 1890s.
